intro: Compsoneura ulei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette of leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or purple, with a distinctive two-lipped structure, and bloom in clusters at the stem tips. Compsoneura ulei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
